intro: Aeollanthus welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch's aeollanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
